intro: Colymbada raphanina, commonly known as the turnip mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its upright stem and alternate leaves that are usually hairy and lobed. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typical of the mustard family. Its fruits are slender pods containing several seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils in temperate regions. Colymbada raphanina is known for its peppery flavor and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
